items.title: Tight Cybersecurity Budgets Accelerate the Shift to AI-Driven Defense
items.description: With cybersecurity budgets strained, organizations are turning to AI-powered automation to plug staffing gaps, maintain defenses, and survive escalating threats. The post Tight Cybersecurity Budgets Accelerate the Shift to AI-Driven Defense appeared first on SecurityWeek.

items.title: Google Says Android pKVM Earns Highest Level of Security Assurance
items.description: Android pKVM has achieved SESIP Level 5 certification, which means it’s resistant to highly skilled, motivated, and funded attackers. The post Google Says Android pKVM Earns Highest Level of Security Assurance appeared first on SecurityWeek.

items.title: State and Local Leaders Lobby Congress for Cybersecurity Resources
items.description: Federal funding cuts to the Multi-State Information Sharing and Analysis Center (MS-ISAC) are about to leave more than 18,000 state and local organizations without access to basic cybersecurity resources they need to protect US national security, a letter sent to Congressional appropriators warns.

items.title: Cybersecurity Spending Slows & Security Teams Shrink
items.description: Security budgets are lowest in healthcare, professional and business services, retail, and hospitality, but budget growth remained above 5% in financial services, insurance, and tech.

"MadeYouReset bypasses the typical server-imposed limit of 100 concurrent HTTP/2 requests per TCP connection from a client. This limit is intended to mitigate DoS attacks by restricting the number of simultaneous

items.description: Threat actors are leveraging a Unicode character to make phishing links appear like legitimate Booking.com links in a new campaign distributing malware. items.title: What Is Out-of-Bounds Read and Write Vulnerability?
items.description: Out-of-bounds read and write vulnerabilities represent critical security vulnerabilities that occur when software accesses memory locations beyond the allocated boundaries of data structures such as arrays, buffers, or other memory regions. These vulnerabilities can lead to information disclosure, system crashes, and in severe cases, arbitrary code execution that allows attackers to gain…
